author: anvacaru
content: Hi everyone! How should the `EXTCODECOPY` behave when the target account does not exist in the state/ has no code? The test linked below looks like it overwrites the local memory with zeroes, but I can't find this defined in the yellow paper. http://retesteth.ethdevops.io/web/index.php?gtests=stBadOpcode&singletest=invalidAddr&clients=t8ntool&snetwork=Berlin&vmtrace=vmtrace&verbosity=STATE&trd=21&trg=0&trv=0

author: _shemnon
content: This is the side effect of one of the ways Ethereum handles out-of-range data: it's all zeros. If you copied past the end of an existing accounts code you would get zero.  So copying any data from a zero length code segment gets you all zeros.

author: _shemnon
content: (RETURNDATACOPY out of range is the exception that proves the rule)
